artist: Artist: Attributed to Pietro da Cortona (Pietro Berrettini)
description: soldier at left wearing helmet handing a spherical object to a standing man at right wearing robes; four figures at center look toward right; two faces at left behind robed man looking left
inscription:
Inscription

bottom center, in black chalk or pencil: [M. Aurelius (?)]
medium: Pen and brown ink and wash; laid down
provenance: Theodore Allen Heinrich, Toronto (his posthumous sale, Christie's, London, July 6, 1982, no. 214, as Circle of Nicolas Poussin, for £150, to Moir); Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1982-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: The Adventus of Hadrian (Marcus Aurelius)
